content.description: A variation of Front & Center that follows a bolt-protected direct line for the second half of the route.
content.protection: Light rack; 7 bolts protect the face climbing on the upper half.

content.description: Slab climbing leads to a roof and the first crux.  The second, more difficult crux, involves a bulge after the roof.  It's easy going after passing the bulge.
content.location: The left most bolt line on South Buttress.

content.description: Climb a right facing corner for about 15 feet, then move onto the face, eventually finishing the route in a left facing corner.
content.protection: Standard rack.  One bolt protects the lower face climbing section.
content.location: To the right of the bolt line for Journey Around the Sun; look for the single bolt protecting the face moves.

content.description: Follow a ledge system that runs into a roof with a large crack running vertical. Pull the interesting roof with good pro placements and follow fun slabs to the ridge. follow ridge up right to a safe belay station.
content.protection: standard rack. 4" camolot for the roof
content.location: Left side of South Buttress. Right side of the roof.

content.description: A variation on A Walk in the Park that goes through the roof after the third bolt via a layback in a crack through the roof.
content.protection: Rack to 2.5".  3 bolts protect the initial slab; there's one more bolt above the roof.
content.location: Same start as A Walk in the Park.

content.description: Start by leading up a steep section with bolts. It will flattern out and gradually grow into steeper slabs. Get to the Left facing dihedral where there is good protection. follow to a good belay ledge at the top.
Slab climbing leads to a roof, which can be climbed directly (Call It What You Want) or bypassed, here, to the right by a crack system.  Plentiful features are available for hands and feet.
content.protection: Rack to 2.5".  3 bolts protect the initial slab.
content.location: Look for the 3-bolt line in the middle of the South Buttress.
